org.metacsp.framework

Class ConstraintSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.metacsp.framework.ConstraintSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    APSPSolver, BooleanSatisfiabilitySolver, FuzzyAllenIntervalNetworkSolver, FuzzySymbolicVariableConstraintSolver, MultiConstraintSolver, RCCConstraintSolver

    public abstract class ConstraintSolver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class provides common infrastructure and functionality for all constraint solvers. All constraint solvers should implement either this class or the MultiConstraint class. The latter is in fact an extension of this class, as it implements the, addConstraintsSub() and removeConstraintsSub() methods. This abstract class also maintains a ConstraintNetwork, which is represented internally as a graph. Any specific solver must implement this abstract class to provide methods to create/remove variables, add/remove constraints, and perform propagation.
    Author:
    Federico Pecora
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible(Constraint c)
        Assess whether a Constraint is compatible with this ConstraintSolver. This is used internally to ignore processing of incompatible constraints by ConstraintSolvers that are aggregated into MultiConstraintSolvers.
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint to check.
        Returns:
        true iff the given Constraint is compatible with this ConstraintSolver.

        Propagate the constraint network.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating the results of the propagation.

      • addConstraint

        public final boolean addConstraint(Constraint c)
        Add a constraint between Variables.
        Parameters:
        c - The constraint to add.
        Returns:
        true iff the constraint was added successfully.

      • addConstraintsDebug

        public final Constraint addConstraintsDebug(Constraint... c)
        Add a batch of constraints between Variables. This method is NOT implemented so as to perform only one propagation, rather it adds all constraints sequentially, and returns the first constraint that fails, null if no constraint fails.
        Parameters:
        c - The constraints to add.
        Returns:
        The first constraint that fails, null if no constraint fails.

      • addConstraints

        public final boolean addConstraints(Constraint... c)
        Add a batch of constraints between Variables. This method is implemented so as to perform only one propagation, thus being more convenient than performing c.length invocations of addConstraint(Constraint c). In addition, all constraints are either accepted or rejected together.
        Parameters:
        c - The constraints to add.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating the success of adding the constraints.

      • addConstraintsSub

        protected abstract boolean addConstraintsSub(Constraint[] c)
        This method must be implemented by the developer of the specific ConstraintSolver class. It should implement all operations necessary to add multiple constraints, and should return true upon success, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        c - The constraints to add.
        Returns:
        true iff the constraints were added to the ConstraintNetwork.

      • removeConstraint

        public final void removeConstraint(Constraint c)
                            throws ConstraintNotFound
        Retract a constraint between Variables.
        Parameters:
        c - The constraint to retract.
        Throws:
        ConstraintNotFound

      • removeConstraints

        public final void removeConstraints(Constraint[] c)
                             throws ConstraintNotFound
        Retract a batch of constraints between Variables. This method should be implemented so as to perform only one propagation, thus being more convenient than performing c.length invocations of removeConstraint(Constraint c). In addition, all constraints should be either accepted or rejected together.
        Parameters:
        c - The constraints to add.
        Throws:
        ConstraintNotFound

      • removeConstraintsSub

        protected abstract void removeConstraintsSub(Constraint[] c)
        This method must be implemented by the developer of the specific ConstraintSolver class. Should implement all operations necessary to remove a batch of constraints.
        Parameters:
        c - The constraints to remove.

      • createVariablesSub

        protected abstract Variable[] createVariablesSub(int num)
        This method must be implemented by the developer of the specific ConstraintSolver class. It should implement all operations necessary to create a batch of variable for the specific type of ConstraintSolver.
        Returns:
        A batch of new Variable for this ConstraintSolver.
